description: One-minute skill: Athens in the Hellenistic Age.

hook.text: After Alexander the Great's death, the Greek world fractured. Certainty collapsed.

buildup.text: Political stability vanished. People searched for personal philosophies to navigate the chaos.

discovery.text: Stoicism, Epicureanism, and Skepticism all emerged in this era â€” competing answers to anxiety.

twist.text: Stoicism won the long game. It shaped Roman law, Christian theology, and modern psychology.

climax.text: Great philosophies often emerge from great instability. Stoicism was no exception.

quiz.question: What historical event triggered the rise of Stoicism?
options: The instability after Alexander the Great's death
